floodArea.county: Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole, Dorset Council, Hampshire

items.message:
Forecast rising river levels this evening may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 22 October 2025 overnight. 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Areas most at risk include tributaries between Ringwood and Christchurch. Weather conditions are expected to improve from tomorrow morning and no further flooding is expected. 
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels . 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Stour and Smestow Brook in the Black Country and South Staffordshire

High river levels this evening may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the evening of 22 October 2025 . 
Flooding may affect low lying land and roads around Halesowen, Stourbridge. Wombourne, Kingswinford and Kinver. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses . Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 
This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message:
Higher than normal tides over the next three days may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from today, Wednesday 22 October, and for the next three days. 
We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning.  The Broads and river levels will remain high over the next couple of days due to tide locking from the current spring tides and surge from a low pressure system. 
We are liaising with emergency services and local authorities . 
Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels on Thursday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 23 October 2025 from  01:00 as intense (but uncertain) rainfall is forecast 
Up to 50mm of rain could occur, but there is low confidence. If as much rain falls as predicted, flooding could affect Hammer Lane, Grove Hill, and Mill Lane Hellingly. From 05:00 23/10/2025 flooding could affect Station Road, Church Lane and Church Road, Hellingly. From 12:00 23/10/2025 minor flooding could affect North Street, River Lane, The Old Clergy House, Deans Place Hotel, Alfriston. Higher levels than 20/10/2025. Rain is forecast to continue until Thursday afternoon. River levels and flood risk should begin to reduce in Hellingly by 17:00 23/10/2025 and Alfriston by 02:00 24/10/2025. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Don't put yourself or others at risk . Avoid roads that flood (Mill Ln Church Rd Hellingly, North St Alfriston). 
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

Forecast rising river levels overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from overnight on 22 October 2025 . 
Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads around Mansfield, the Sherwood Forest Caravan Park at Clipstone, Edwinstowe, Ollerton, Whitewater Lane at Whitewater Bridge and West Drayton. Heavy rainfall is forecast from 23:00 tonight. 22/10/2025, through to the early hours of tomorrow morning. 23/10/2025. River levels at Whitewater Bridge Gauge are expeted to rise from 06:00 on 23/10/2025 and  levels are expected to remain high until 12:00 on 23/10/2025. 
We are clearing blockages from debris screens . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message: Forecast rising river levels through tonight may lead to flooding.  Areas most at risk are low-lying recreational areas and roads including High School playing fields on Valley Road and other low lying land and recreational areas, low lying land and roads around the Tottle Brook. River levels at Day Brook Gauge are expected to rise tonight, 22/10/2025, from 23:30, and may remain high until 12:00, 23/10/2025  We are closely monitoring the situation & clearing debris from weed screens. Monitor local water levels and weather conditions & avoid using low-lying footpaths near watercourses. This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

High tides and forecast weather conditions throughout the evening may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 00:15 to 02:15 on Thursday 23 October. 
Tide levels will be high around the boat yard in Felixstowe Ferry hamlet at the end of Ferry Road, and along riverside areas in Woodbridge and Waldringfield, as well as in surrounding marshland. The detailed forecast is for a peak level at  Harwich of 2.63 mAODN at 1:15am, tomorrow Thursday 23 October, which is 0.63m above tide tables, Wind Force 6, Easterly. Tides are expected to be higher than usual, due to the forecast weather conditions during spring tides. 
We are closing locks and flood gates . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 8:00AM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

The main areas of concern are Newton Abbot, Kingsteignton, Teignmouth, Shaldon, Bovey Tracey, Kingskerswell, Dawlish and Dawlish Warren.

We expect the rivers to remain high throughout Thursday though no flooding to properties is currently forecast.

items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message:
High river levels tomorrow morning may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 23 October 2025 . 
The forecast high tide at Richmond is 4.70 mAOD at 04:15 AM on 23/10/2025.

We believe there is a possibility of flooding for Putney Embankment (SW15), Chiswick Mall and Strand on the Green (W4), Thames Bank at Mortlake (SW14), Ranelagh Drive (TW1), Friars Lane and Water Lane (TW9), Riverside and The Embankment at Twickenham, and the Towpath below Teddington Lock. Flooding of properties is not expected.

Astronomical tide levels are rising. The river flow at Teddington Weir is 30 cubic metres per second and is rising. We anticipate the flows to rise slowly for the next few days. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

High tides on Thursday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible for 2 hours either side of Thursday's early morning tide at 01:00 on 23/10/2025. 
The weather increases tide table values by 0.42 m. Total forecast tide is 6.12 metres Chart Datum (3.07 mAOD) at Littlehampton. Strong South Westerly Force 6 wind. 
Waves could cause overtopping of the beach, affecting Climping Street Car Park. A small amount of water may then flow or be directed westwards along Mill Lane towards residential property in Climping Street. Thursday's tide at 13:15 23/10/2025 is forecast to be 10 cm lower (2.97 mAOD).  Similar minor flood impacts could continue until Saturday, but in general should reduce over the week ahead. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . We routinely check the condition of the beach at Climping 
Consider activating any flood protection products you may have . Access could be restricted. Take care if visiting Climping beach. 
This message will be updated by 6:00PM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole, Dorset Council

items.message:
High tides, strong winds and large waves overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 7pm to 11pm on 22/10/2025. 
Locations most affected will be coastal roads and footpaths. Areas most at risk include Swanage Bay. In Swanage there may be a risk to the lower end of High Street road by the Pier Head so avoid parking vehicles in this area due to wave overtopping and flying debris. The detailed tidal forecast for those who use it is for a peak level at Bournemouth of 1.16 mAODN at 9pm on 22/10/2025, which is 0.6 m above tide tables, with North Easterly force 6 winds. (mAODN is height above average sea level.) After tonight's high tide, no further coastal flooding is expected. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . Also avoid beaches and coastal promenades, which may also be flooded. 
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
High tides and forecast weather conditions tomorrow morning may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 06:30 to 08:30 on Thursday morning. 
Areas particularly at risk include low lying areas of Fowey and The Quay at Looe.

The high tide at Plymouth on Thursday is at 07:23, times of high water will vary along the coast.  Forecast total high tide level is 2.56mAOD. Expect tide levels along the coast to be between 0.2 and 0.3 metres above tide table level. Force 4 north westerly winds and offshore wave heights of around 3.8m are forecast over the high tide.

Coastal conditions should ease for Thursday evening's high tide. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

The detailed forecast is for a peak level at  Clacton of 2.86mAODN at 1:30am, tomorrow Thursday 23 October, which is 0.44m above tide tables, Wind Force 7, South-easterly. items.message:

Heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours, with low confidence in locations and timing. River levels at Pinxton Gauge will begin rising at 23:45 on 22/10/2025. Levels will remain high until 12:00 noon on 23/10/2025. 
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels . 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses .

items.description: River Erewash Tributaries in Derbyshire and Nottinghamshire

floodArea.riverOrSea: Golden Brook, Beauvale Brook, Bailey Brook, Boundary Brook, Golden Stream

items.message:
Forecast rising river levels overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 23 October 2025 . 
Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads around the tributaries to the River Erewash near the border of Derbyshire and Nottinghamshire, including Golden Brook and Stream, Boundary Brook, Nut Brook, Bailey Brook, Beauvale Brook and Nether Green Brook. Heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours, with low confidence over timing and locations. We expect river levels to begin rising from 23:45 on 22/10/2025. Levels will remain high until 12:00 noon on 23/10/2025. 
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels . 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses . 
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

High tides are expected to cause flooding tomorrow morning. 
Flooding is expected from 04:00 to 08:30 on 23/20/25. 
Locations most affected will be the North Sea coast from Mappleton to Spurn Point. 
We are closely monitoring the situation and this warning will be updated as necessary. 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . Also avoid beaches and coastal promenades, which may be flooded. 
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels on Wednesday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 22 October 2025 from 19:30 as intense (but uncertain) rainfall is forecast. 
Up to 40mm of rain could occur, but there is low confidence in location. If as much rain falls as predicted, then flooding could be possible. Flooding could affect roads, and approach a small number of properties on Stonehouse Drive, Hollington Old Lane, Blackman Avenue and Coventry Road. River levels could possibly peak higher than on Monday. Rain is forecast to continue until Thursday afternoon (23/10/2025). River levels and flood risk should begin to reduce in Hastings by 13:00 23/10/2025. 
We are closely monitoring the situation clearing debris screens including Stonehouse Drive. 
Consider activating any flood protection products you may have Install flood protection products on Stonehouse Drive. 
This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels on Wednesday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 22 October 2025 from 19:30 as intense (but uncertain) rainfall is forecast. 
Up to 40mm of rain could occur, but there is low confidence in location. If as much rain falls as predicted, then flooding could be possible. Flooding could affect roads, and approach a small number of properties on Thanet Way, Pegwell Close and Manston Way, as well as areas in Alexandra Park, Hastings. River levels could possibly peak higher than on Monday. Rain is forecast to continue until Thursday afternoon (23/10/2025). River levels and flood risk should begin to reduce in Hastings by 13:00 23/10/2025. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Consider activating any flood protection products you may have Prepare to keep water from homes Thanet Way, Manston Way and Pegwell Close. 
This message will be updated by 12:30AM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels on Wednesday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the evening of 22 October 2025 from 19:30 as intense (but uncertain) rainfall is forecast. 
Up to 80mm of rain could possibly be recorded, but there is currently low confidence in location. If as much rain falls as predicted, then flooding could be possible. Flooding could affect Bridge Road. River levels could come out of bank, this would increase flood depths in the road and at the riverside car park. Rain is forecast to continue until Thursday afternoon (23/10/2025). River levels and flood risk should begin to reduce in Emsworth by 01:00 PM 23/10/2025. 
We are closely monitoring the situation and will clear debris screens if necessary. 
Consider activating any flood protection products you may have . 
This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels on Wednesday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the evening of 22 October 2025 from 19:30 as intense (but uncertain) rainfall is forecast. 
Up to 80mm of rain could possibly be recorded, but there is currently low confidence in location. If as much rain falls as predicted, then flooding could be possible. Flooding could affect Marymead Close, and the Simeon Street recreation ground. We will install drop boards in Simeon Street Rec Ground if necessary. For those who are vulnerable to flooding as a result of excess surface water in roads or poor drainage generally, as a precautionary measure, you may wish to install flood protection before the rain begins. River levels and flood risk should reduce by 01:00 PM on Thursday 23/10/2025. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.
